keyword.definition: A tornado watch means that conditions are right for a tornado to form.
An All Hazards Weather Radio broadcasts weather forecasts and warnings day and night.
The word widget is usually used to describe some sort of mechanical device that doesn't have a real name.

When the columns of air inside a cloud move up and down, they “rub together.” This causes energy in the form of static electricity to build up inside the cloud. When the buildup releases, it causes the lightning flash.
Lightning is a flash of light that is produced by the discharge of electricity between a cloud and the ground or between two clouds in the sky.
Thunder is the sound that is produced by lightning. Since sound travels slower than light, the sound always comes after the lightning.
When rain falls faster than the ground can soak it up, it sometimes causes a flood. With nowhere else to go, the water runs off into rivers and streets. Never play in flood waters!
People fill bags full of sand and put them in front of doors or other places to help keep flood waters out.
A super cell is a very large and very powerful storm.
Frost are the ice crystals that form on a very cold surface.
Hail or hailstones are pellets or balls of ice formed inside thunderstorm clouds. When they fall to earth, they can cause lots of damage.

keyword.word: The wind began to switch directions
keyword.definition: Before a tornado the wind often switches direction very quickly. The sky is often a dark green color.
A tornado warning means that a tornado has been spotted.
Schools often have a drill so you can practice what to do in case of an emergency.
